page.title: 04CHURCH AND CHAPEL
page.content: Shirwell Church is a thirteenth century Norman Church. It has an average congregation of only fifteen. There are six bells which are rung for ten minutes before each service and there is a bell ringing group who practice regularly. There are two Churchwardens who look after the church and keep it in order. Also in Shirwell is a Methodist Chapel. A few more people go to Chapel than to the Church of England service and a Sunday School is provided there for the young members of the community. At present, there is no resident vicar in Shirwell and the visiting vicar who serves the Church will retire shortly after which it is planned that vicars from other parishes will take it in turns to come to Shirwell on a Sunday.
